Topic: Draw a habitat and the different living things in each
Evidence Statements: The student can identify and draw a specific habitat, such as a garden, forest, pond, or stream.
The student can draw different types of plants found in the chosen habitat, such as trees, grasses, bushes, or flowering plants.
The student can draw different types of animals found in the chosen habitat, such as lizards, squirrels, ants, fish, or clams.
The student can illustrate comparisons by drawing the diversity of living things in another habitat and noting the differences.
The student can observe and represent patterns in the types of plants and animals across different habitats.
